Package com.intellij.openapi.module

Interface Module

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AreaInstance, ComponentManager, Disposable, UserDataHolder
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ModuleEx
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CoreModule, ModuleImpl

    public interface Module
extends ComponentManager, AreaInstance, Disposable
    Represents a module in an IDEA project.
    See Also:
    ModuleManager.getModules(), ModuleComponent

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.intellij.openapi.Disposable

        Disposable.Parent

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ELEMENT_TYPE 
      static Module[] EMPTY_ARRAY
      The empty array of modules which cab be reused to avoid unnecessary allocations.

        the virtual file instance.

      • getModuleFilePath

        @SystemIndependent java.lang.String getModuleFilePath()
        System-independent path to the .iml file or empty string if module is not persistent.

        Returns the project to which this module belongs.

      • getModuleScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleScope()
        Returns:
        module scope including source and tests, excluding libraries and dependencies.

      • getModuleScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleScope(boolean includeTests)
        Parameters:
        includeTests - whether to include test source
        Returns:
        module scope including source and, optionally, tests, excluding libraries and dependencies.

      • getModuleWithLibrariesScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleWithLibrariesScope()
        Returns:
        module scope including source, tests, and libraries, excluding dependencies.

      • getModuleWithDependenciesScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleWithDependenciesScope()
        Returns:
        module scope including source, tests, and dependencies, excluding libraries.

      • getModuleContentScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleContentScope()
        Returns:
        a scope that includes everything in module content roots, without any dependencies or libraries

      • getModuleContentWithDependenciesScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleContentWithDependenciesScope()
        Returns:
        a scope that includes everything under the content roots of this module and its dependencies, with test source

      • getModuleWithDependenciesAndLibrariesScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleWithDependenciesAndLibrariesScope(boolean includeTests)
        Parameters:
        includeTests - whether test source and test dependencies should be included
        Returns:
        a scope including module source and dependencies with libraries

      • getModuleWithDependentsScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleWithDependentsScope()
        Returns:
        a scope including everything under the content roots of this module and all modules that depend on it, directly or indirectly (via exported dependencies), excluding test source and resources

      • getModuleTestsWithDependentsScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleTestsWithDependentsScope()
        Returns:
        same as getModuleWithDependentsScope(), but with test source/resources included

      • getModuleRuntimeScope

        GlobalSearchScope getModuleRuntimeScope(boolean includeTests)
        Parameters:
        includeTests - whether test source and test dependencies should be included
        Returns:
        a scope including production (and optionally test) source of this module and all modules and libraries it depends upon, including runtime and transitive dependencies, even if they're not exported.

        default java.lang.String getModuleTypeName()

        default void setModuleType(java.lang.String name)
